reviewText:
Early Access Review

PLEASE NOTE: THIS IS AN EARLY ACCESS REVIEW

Did you ever hear of Skyhook before being on it's store page for the first time?

Me neither.

It's kinda one of those games you learn of by some obscure indie reviewer/blogger, or by chance. For me, it was the latter. I'd recently ordered a Steam Link so I could play games on the big TV in my living room. I figured I should try picking up some local-multiplayer games for when I have my friends over, so I did a Steam store search of games with both the Full-Controller Support" and "Local Multiplayer" tags. I found Skyhook about half-way through the fourth set of results. After seeing both the neat gameplay and the 50% off discount
date:
I thought to myself "ehh...why not?" and got it.

Was it worth it?

Absolutely! Even though it's still in Early Access
recommended: it's amazingly good! Here are some more specific details as to why:\n\nThe gameplay is unique
voteText: and downright fun! The easiest way for me to describe it is Super Smash Bros. with hookshots and 1-hit kills. There's cannon turrets
votesTotal: various game-modes ranging from classic Deathmatch to Sky Ball (Skyhook's take on basketball)
votesFunny: as well as a list of modifiers you can add to change things up. Each gamemode has a team option
commentsCount: and can be played with difficulty-adjustable AI bots.\n\nSpeaking of which
column16: the AI is commendable. The bots are good at navigating the stages
column17: and can really give you a challenge (especially when you put their difficulty on hard xD). The bots can also fill empty slots when you're playing with only 1 or 2 other friends.\n\nCurrently
column18: there are five characters to play as (four available right off the bat; one unlockable) and five available maps (the layouts get switched around each time a map is played
column19: which helps add some variation to the stages)
column20: and the developer is planning to add more in the future
column21: as well as other new content.\n\nWhich also reminds me. Skyhook's developer
column22: Megastorm Games (which is only one guy
column24: is actively listening and responding to community feedback/questions. So far
column25: I've posted a question concerning bots
column27: and suggested a new control scheme; each time I got a friendly
column28: helpful reply from the dev. #awesomeindiedev\n\nControllers are recommended (I personally use a Xbox 360 gamepad)
column29: but a keyboard works fine as well. You can also use a keyboard along with controllers when playing with friends.\n\nOh
column30: and there's also some pretty cool Twitch integration. This video showcases how that works.\n\nIn conclusion
column36: albeit with a few minor bugs here and there (that will inevitably be fixed as development progresses). At a low cost of $5 (and even less when on discount)
column37:
Skyhook should be a definite purchase for anyone desiring a unique game to play with/without friends. Why are you still reading this? GO BUY IT!!!!!

TL:DR

Awesome Gameplay

column41: then get hookshotted to death by a teleporting desert princess-assassin.\n\n10/10"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Like most Indie Games on Steam, you've probably never heard of Skyhook. It's a local multiplayer action platformer, or a less fancy term would be party game. As of late the market has become very saturated with party games. They have become the newest trend in gaming, from Nidhogg, Towerfall, and Gang Beasts, you name it, they come in just about every flavor. Skyhook looks to make a name for itself in a big market. Now while this title is still in active development and on Early Access, the basic core mechanic of the game is in place.

Why that would be grappling hooks of course! Who doesn't love grappling hooks, they're the best item in all of Zelda games and Batman! Skyhook challenges you with murdering your best friends using grappling hooks in its multiple arenas/levels. If grappling hooks aren't enough, hop aboard the floating ship and blast them in the face with a cannon. Now I will admit that there is only a certain amount of content to be explored here in Skyhook. Despite this though, with the right group of buddies, Skyhook can have some very dynamic and interesting battles as you bounce around its levels like a monkey on crack.

Of course Skyhook features the same delicious amount of pixel goodness we have come to expect from party games. The characters are all very colorful, designed neatly and seemingly have a bit of personality. The level designs are pretty solid and allow for some pretty crazy matches as you desperately try to hook your friends to death. There are some bugs though, this is Early Access. The floating ship can be piloted into a position which makes it unusable and it just floats there like a log. Bugs are to be expected though as development continues.

Other features include items that can give you a key advantage in combat, from invisibility, to mirror imaging yourself on the other players. These items add a bit of brawl" style flair to matches and a little break from just hooking people over and over. Multiple people can also use the same keyboard for Skyhook
date: including controllers which I find to be a bit more intuitive with these types of games. Thankfully Skyhook does feature full controller support
recommended: so there isn't much stress in finding one that works. Also other game modes like Team Deathmatch
voteText: and Steam Tank which limits your grappling hooks.\n\nI had fun with Skyhook
helpfulPercent: but of course the major caveat of the game is that it requires other people to play with
votesHelpful: in order for the game to be enjoyed. With no online multiplayer and no current single player campaign
votesTotal: there is only so much you can play before you move along. Now while it is still early to make a call on Skyhook
votesFunny: I feel the game does have some interesting potential. Grapple hooking enemies isn't the newest concept but still can be innovated in some interesting ways. Adding shifting levels dynamics like on the level seen above is a good example. Perhaps a level that is scrolling sideways/up or take a note from Speedrunners and make a racing level but solely based off your grapple hooking skills. Make a level that has glowing stars to be collected behind several dangerous obstacles
commentsCount: first to three wins. These are just some examples of what Skyhook could become.\n\nThere are many possibilities for Skyhook
column16: as long as the developer continues working passionately. I am happy to say that while cruising the Skyhook Steam forums
column17: I noticed a daily development blog that had scores of minor tweaks and updates being made. This is the kinda thing you want to see out of a developer
column18: and should put some fears to rest for those burned by Early Access games before.\n\nSpeaking to the future of Skyhook
column19: the developers planned features include more characters
column21: more powers ups and environmental effects
column22: new vehicles and mounts. Not to mention a single player/co-op campaign that will have 40 levels and other unlockable goodies. It is important to underline that online multiplayer is not a planned feature currently.\n\nSo if you're in the market for a fun party game
column23: want something that combines elements of Mario
column26: Skyhook might be just the game you're looking for in your gaming library. Just remember to make sure you have some friends who don't mind coming over instead of playing online"

reviewText:
Short Summary
Skyhook is a 4 player local multiplayer arena fighting game centering around a grappling hook mechanic and one hit kills. The game is similar to games like Towerfall and Samurai Gunn. It is very easy to pick up and learn, and has a decently high skill ceiling that involves reaction-based dodging and good usage of the grappling hook to get around.

Every player has a hookshot, which allows you to cling onto platforms and move around the arena quickly. The hookshot also works as a weapon, allowing you to kill other players, along with a melee mechanic. At any point, however, you're able to dodge, which gives you invulnerability frames, allowing you to pass through attacks. Each character has a different style of dodge, which is the defining factor making them unique.

Skyhook offers both a good multiplayer and single player experience. With a roster of 5 characters, and 4 different game modes, the multiplayer is fun and addicting. The controls are very responsive, and any mistakes you make don't feel like it's the fault of the game. Skyhook offers a good amount of content for it's current price. ($10)

Multiplayer
Multiplayer fights are the main draw to Skyhook. As previously stated, there are 5 characters and 4 modes. There's additionally 5 different arena types, each with 2 maps each. The maps contain unique elements, turrets, moving platforms, and drive-able ships, but none of these elements are overburdening and take away from the game itself. Additionally there are items delivered randomly via chests, offering various, but not overbearing effects.

The main game mode is straightforward, be the last one alive in a fight where everyone has a set amount of lives. The other modes include 'skyball' where you have to carry and throw a ball into the enemy's goal, 'grab the loot' which requires you to hold on to a bag to increase your score, and a mode that limits the amount of hooks you can shoot, with the only way to reload being standing on a platform. These modes are fairly unique, and don't feel like just a side-thought to the main game.

There is no online multiplayer currently, only local multiplayer. The developer has expressed interest in an online mode, but this is not guaranteed.

Single Player
The single-player experience has not been neglected. There is a quest mode to the game that offers several unique challenges, each with their own individual high scores and achievable medal tiers. There are no online leaderboards for the top scores, however. This mode also allows you to unlock additional skins for characters, as well as the unlockable stage and 5th character.

Additionally, this game has bot AI that allows you to play the multiplayer modes by yourself. While the AI performs well in most scenarios, it has a tendency to sometimes fall off the stage or sometimes get stuck, though these issues are not terribly bad. The AI has extreme difficulty with the lava stages, however, and will often jump itself into lava a lot.

ProsResponsive controls
Enjoyable, addicting combat
Easy to learn, and the singleplayer trials let you practice your skills to become even better
Unlockable content
Developer is quick to respond to bugs and issues
Good singleplayer and multiplayer content.
ConsLocal multiplayer only, no online
AI sometimes gets stuck or makes poor decisions
Should you buy it?
If you are looking for an enjoyable local multiplayer game that allows you to easily pick up and play with a group of friends, I would recommend this game. If you are looking for strictly a single-player game, this may not be the best choice, but you may be interested in picking it up when it's on sale.

reviewText:
Product received for free

This game is one of the best video games of all time!
At first I didn't expect to much. I had some fun playing it at SmashCon and enjoyed winning my first tournament, but I didn't really think this game could become so great.
QUEST MODE:
Allows people with no friends they can play with to enjoy unlocking some stuff to play against CPU opponents!
Jaguar Jade and Hammer Fin are sooooo cool!
VS MODE:
The main mode of the game. Its so unique! I love it! Its like samurai gunn with grappling hooks and sky pirates, you have to always watch out for attacks from any direction! Its way too much fun!
Overall, I would rate this game 9.7/10
The only reasons i wont rate it 10/10 is because
1. Enemies who suicide in quest mode don't count for your score.
2. The game data resets when some updates are released.
If you have friends who can come and play steam couch multiplayer games with you, then buy this. You will have a blast trying to fight your friends (who are now sharks and cats) with a grappling hook and a gryphon.
A must buy for any fan of Duck Game, Samurai Gunn, or Towerfall Ascension!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

!!!EARLY ACCESS REVEIW!!!
TLDR: Local Multiplayer Action Platformer with grapling hooks, and recovering from a bad fall is hard if not impossible.

BIAS:I have not played much of this game, but there isnt much to it at this time so I thought a review was in proper order. I love super smash brothers enough that I spent over 100$ to get a gamecube, controllers, and melee. Duck game is my current fav game. So its safe to say that I love the Genre and as long as the game isnt too terrible I will play almost anything in this Genre.

As stated in the TLDR this is a Local Multiplayer Action Platformer, akin to super smash brothers, duck game, and towerfall. There are currently 4 playable characters, but play style does not differ very much between characters. Some are faster, some have longer grapling hooks etc. There are 3 different levels, The Castle, the Egyptian tomb, and the snowy mountains. Those are not the real names, but its a good summary of the levels. the maps themselvs vary, with platforms at different places each time. I am not currently away if this is random generation or pre set generations, but either way it provides a good amount of replayablity.

GAMEPLAY: The 1-4 players move around the level by jumping and using their grapling hooks. Kills are made by hitting a player with a grappling hook, and one hit is enough to kill a player. You can die by falling off the map. Each player has a set amount of lives and last one with lives win. It is really that simple. However it is fun. And for 5$ this is not too much to ask for. It is importaint to note that this is early access and more features are coming soon.

This game does have AI, and the AI is ok most of the time, although they do have a tendancy to just stand still.

I have found this game to shine at its best when having 4 players(AI or human) on a TV with controllers on the snowy mountian map. THIS GAME DOES HAVE FULL CONTROLLER SUPPORT. AND I SUGGEST YOU USE IT

Pro:
-fun gameplay
-cheap
-easy to get the general idea and start playing, hard to master movement with grappling hook

Con:
-(EDIT: Devs taught me how, its actually easy, +1 for awesome Devs, disregard following on recovery) it is RIDICULOUSLY HARD to recover. If you are on the castle or egytain tomb map and you find yourself hanging off the edge of the tall towers towards the bottom of the map, your screwed. It is almost impossible to recover. That or I suck at recovery. It would be nice if that was made easier.
-Keyboard is not solid. But it seems like a game to play with controllers anyways, I cant think that this can be fixed.

Overall a nice fun party game that I am legitimatly excited to play with my friends. I am very excited to see where this game will go.
Online play would be nice. Arcade mode will be awesome.
9/10 would cause a cat and a shark to fall to their deaths while being a viking with a grapling hook again.

GAMEPLAY EXAMPLE: https://youtu.be/mjppEgwC-l4

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game caught my attention with its art style and I'm glad I further pursued it! The grappling hook mechanic will keep you addicted for hours, it's simple to understand yet hard to master. The character designs are well thought out (this is my opinions to what their persona's are like) You have the Terror of the 7 Seas Fin (my favourite), the mysterious assassin Anara, Runa the fearless Viking, and the battle hungry warrior Jade! The stages have a great vibrant palette with iconic mechanics, i.e.  the castle stage you can fly a ship and shoots cannons. The modes will keep you entertained for hours and there are currently 5; Deathmatch, Steam Tank, Sky Slayers, Capture the Swag, and Team Deathmatch.
I highly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys the genre or who is completely new to it! If you want to check it out I made a Let's Play Video of the game!

Link to the Let's Play Video: https://youtu.be/L4Mk0rbXwFA

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So I was at a Convention, Super Smash Con, and the devs of this game had a booth up. A lot of people were crowding around and playing it, so my friends and I decided to go check it out. The game is basically like Super Smash Brothers, except you have to hit the enemy with a grappling hook to kill them. We start playing, and I soon became addicted. The devs asked if we wanted to sign up for the tournament they were having for free Steam Keys, my friends and I agreed to sign up. I lost in the first tournament immediately, but I wanted a Key so bad. I started practicing at the booth against random people, I soon became very good. Then comes the second tournament. I make it up to the finals. I won, and it was ♥♥♥♥ing awesome. The devs gave me a key, and then said that I can compete in the winners tournament they were having later. I ended up having to leave early, but devs gave me 4 extra keys for my friends and I. 10/10 Devs.

For the over all game score, I can't rate it as of now. The core mechanics are there, 4 characters, and a few levels, but there just isn't enough game" yet.

Devs
recommended: priortize adding multiplayer and ranked play. If you can do that right
hoursPlayed: I think you have a real gem on your hands. I can forsee myself sinking many hours into this game.\n\nFor everyone else
voteText: this game is amazing for game night. I would really recommend buying a copy of the game to support the devs. I met them and they seem like really nice people."
